intro: Sciadopanax baehnianus, commonly known as the Baehnian arrowhead plant, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white flowers followed by bright red berries that are edible for some animals. Sciadopanax baehnianus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
